Description: Two joining body sherds of North Ionian pottery bowl; cream slip; interior: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white; above, goat to right; below, goat grazing to left; exterior: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white; above, minimal scrap; below, goat to right, looking back, with added red; large pendant roette as fill.
Curator's comments: GR 1924,1201,235, 943-949 and 971 probably all belong to the same bowl, with some doubt about this sherd; on the inside it has key maeander at the rim above lotus and bud frieze; there are two goat friezes below. Outside has key maeander at rim, black-figure animals in handle zone, and two goat friezes below, above a lotus band near the foot. Here appears the only goat with reversed head.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.202)
